definition: New Fourth army of Republic of China, set up in 1937 and controlled by the communists
abbr. for Xinjiang 新疆[Xin1 jiang1] or Singapore 新加坡[Xin1 jia1 po1]/surname Xin

sentences.english: In order to the Japanese island, only found near a body of the new fourth army.
sentences.chinese: 而到達島上的日本人，只發現近一個連的新四軍屍體。

sentences.english: To declare that the New Fourth Army has "mutinied" and cancel its official designation.
sentences.chinese: 宣佈新四軍“叛變”，取消該軍番號。

sentences.english: However, it is possible to prove that any NFA is reducible to an equivalent DFA.
sentences.chinese: 不過，可以證明，任何新四軍是還原相當於裝配。

sentences.english: Southern anhui incident, the reconstruction of the new fourth army headquarters.
sentences.chinese: “皖南事變”後，新四軍重建軍部。

sentences.english: Later, he gave up his study and became a famous artist in the new 4th army corps.
sentences.chinese: 後來投筆從戎，成爲新四軍中的一位著名藝術家。

sentences.english: But the new fourth army drug and medical equipment as are scarce.
sentences.chinese: 但新四軍的藥品及醫療器械照舊奇缺。

sentences.english: Jun-jie hao to worry about the ability of the new fourth army, he is waiting for hydrostatic county of good news.
sentences.chinese: 郝俊傑擔心新四軍的能力，他在等靜水縣的好消息。

definition: political commissar (during Russian and Chinese communist revolutions)
He Long (1896-1969), important communist military leader, died from persecution during the Cultural Revolution
Nanchang Uprising, 1st August 1927, the beginning of military revolt by the Communists in the Chinese Civil War
War of Liberation (1945-49), after which the Communists 共產黨武裝|共产党武装 under Mao Zedong 毛澤東|毛泽东 took over from the Nationalists 國民政府|国民政府 under Chiang Kai-shek 蔣介石|蒋介石
commander-in-chief/top military commander for a country or theater of operations
Military Commission of the Communist Party Central Committee
Autumn Harvest Uprising (1927), insurrection in Hunan and Jiangxi provinces led by Mao Zedong
geographical area of command/(PLA) military district
